title: Markowitsch 2015 Ried Kirchweingarten Zweigelt (Carnuntum)
description: A restrained red cherry aroma melds with bitter almond on the nose. Juicy fruit flavors are unleashed on the fresh, lively palate where enough structure and tannic grip support this medium-bodied wine. Bright acidity highlights the aromatic cherry fruit and a dusting of cinnamon. Lovely now but sure to evolve. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Muhr-Van der Niepoort 2015 Sydhang Syrah (Carnuntum)
description: Violet, smoke, white pepper and meat come together on an intensely spicy nose. All the hallmarks of Syrah are there: the inky intensity, the heady aroma, the visceral notions of flesh and smoke. The palate intesifies this but remains taut, concentrated and slender. Right now this has teenage excitement and will sweep you along in its exuberance. If you wait, this will calm down into floral elegance. The firm tannic structure, full fruit and freshness give this a long lease of life. 2018–2028.

title: Neumeister 2016 Ried Steintal Roter Traminer (Vulkanland Steiermark)
description: The tell-tale scent of rose petals is tempered by fresh orange zest aromas on the nose of this wine. An unusual member of the Traminer family, it sings with creamy but textured freshness, centered around a glorious streak of zesty lemon. The flavors linger long and intensely on the dry finish.

title: Nigl 2016 Ried Pellingen Privat Riesling (Kremstal)
description: A tart, tangy hint of ripe grapefruit mixes with the lemon notes on the nose of this wine. The palate brims with juicy, tart apple notes, its slender body both concentrated and vibrant. It's incredibly fruity, tangy and just about dry, with a totally mouthwatering finish.

title: R&A; Pfaffl 2016 Hommage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: A wonderfully ripe notion of yellow pear plays on the nose of this wine. Its bright, friendly fruitiness is also amply apparent on the creamy palate, where it's joined by a savory element of soy, salt and miso. A little citrus pith adds even more texture to this rich, rounded wine.

title: S.R. Tonella 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: From a producer making small amounts of wine from Rutherford fruit—much of it estate and farmed by hand—this powerhouse is impressively crafted and memorable, offering smoky oak, graphite and clove. The palate is concentrated in black berry and plum tones, and broadly expansive on the palate, finishing with a welcome succulence.

title: Steininger 2016 Ried Loisium Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine's soy-scented miso notes create an immensely savory nose. The palate centers on those yeasty textures and flavors, but a citrusy streak of lemon freshness brightens and highlights them. This is concentrated and intense, with lots of aging potential. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Tegernseerhof 2016 Bergdistel Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: The nose of this wine boasts pear, celery salt and herbal spice notes. The palate delivers a savory tingle of white pepper and salty soy but also adds luminous, fresh, ripe lemon zest for an incisive, savory and dramatic package. The finish is lip-smacking and long. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Turnbull 2015 Black Label Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This bold, beautifully made wine is sizable in tannin while imparting an old-world entry of herbaceousness and classic notions of pencil shavings and cedar. Gritty on the palate, it flirts with black cherry, currant and cassis before offering a rounded lengthy finish of clove and tobacco.

title: Wieninger 2016 Ried Rosengartl White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)
description: This wine's ripe mirabelle plum and fragrant lemon notes stream from the glass. The palate has the same appetizing contrast between rounded ripeness and fragrant freshness. The lemon tone creates a zesty, lively and textured palate. Very fresh and delicious right now, it's sure to develop. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Williams Selyem 2011 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)
description: Rich and roasty on the nose, this excellent Port-style wine shows aromas of cherry cordial, charred fennel, black sage and roast beef. The dense sip offers black cherry, espresso, blueberry jelly and thick chocolate flavors, enhanced by a hint of menthol and Scotch-like elements.

title: Capannelle 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Pressed iris, red-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of rosemary lead the nose on this 100% Sangiovese. The supple, juicy palate delivers black cherry, white pepper, leather and star anise alongside velvety, polished tannins. It's already accessible but will also age well for the next several years or more. Drink through 2025.

title: Carlisle 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dense black currant, lanolin, leather and vanilla aromas are lifted by sagebrush and dried mint on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the famous vineyard. The palate is jam-packed with herbs, from oregano and thyme to juniper, with blackberry rising in the midpalate and spearmint and more vanilla carrying through the finish.

title: Château Thivin 2016 Cuvée Zaccharie  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: This small-production wine, produced from parcels of old vines, is impressive for its richness and density. With flavors from wood aging adding spice as well as giving extra structural dimension, the wine is set for good aging. Do not drink before 2019.

title: Domaine des Marrans 2016 Corcelette  (Morgon)
description: From one of the top districts of Morgon, this wine is well structured and offers rich fruits. A good mix of spice and black fruit is supported by tannins. It is a rich, juicy wine with an impressive future. Drink from 2019.

title: Buchegger 2016 Ried Moosburgerin Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: Amalfi lemon notes—just hinted at on the nose—get their full expression on the streamlined palate of this wine. It's focused, clean, slender and pithy, oozing freshness and charm in equal measure. The finish is clean, brisk, dry and lasting. Drink through 2030.

title: Pedroncelli 2015 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is aged in American oak and blended with 12% Petite Sirah. Concentrated blackberry fruit rides a foundation of soft, silky and well-integrated succulence, with touches of leather saddle, black pepper, smoke and brick. While full bodied, it manages to drink light on its feet.

title: Domaine Gaget 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)
description: The chapel of La Madone is the landmark of Fleurie, set at the top of a hill above vineyards. This wine from a five-acre parcel of 70-year-old vines is concentrated and full of ripe black-cherry fruits. Its weight and intensity will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Ried Sauberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine's nose is shy at first but opens to reveal a note of salty yeast. The palate unfolds into a creamy but streamlined expression of salt, chervil, lemon zest and pith. It may need some time to mellow, but its wonderfully fresh streak of zesty citrus promises longevity. Drink 2019–2029.

title: Eder 2016 Smaragd Traminer (Wachau)
description: A touch of rose, a notion of honeysuckle and the heady scent of blood orange zest spell aromatic pleasure. The palate falls in with a slender creaminess that corsets all that floral richness, giving shape and direction. Lemon freshness illuminates every nuance, resulting in an extremely elegant wine with a textured, dry and long echoing finish. Mandarine notes continue to dance.

title: Giesen 2012 Clayvin Single Vineyard Selection Syrah (Marlborough)
description: This complex Syrah is from Giesen's top vineyard. Lifted aromas of blackberry jam, roasted meats, black pepper, florals and graphite are followed by a satiny palate of plush, raisiny fruit and silky tannins.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Oberer Wald Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Heady notes of peony mix with woodsmoke and mahogany, plum and black cherry on the nose. The palate is still taut with fine, stilly drying tannin but brims with oak-kissed fruit. This is structured and dense, muscular but harmonious. A big wine with elenace and power which will benefit from bottle age. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Heinrich Hartl 2014 Graf Weingartl Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)
description: The aromatic allure of tiny, dark elderberries captures the nose. They also appear on the palate, embraced by vanilla and polished notes of new oak. The structure is firm but the body is sinuous and marked by vivid freshness. Made in an international style, this will integrate over the coming months to present a sumptuous and elegant Pinot Noir.

title: Hiedler 2016 Ried Kittmannsberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: The first whiff of this wine, with its concentrated hit of pear peel and citrus pith, spells pleasure. The palate adds a softening, enriching touch of creamy yeast as a backdrop to the rich, fruit-driven flavors: pear, fern, sage and Meyer lemon. The finish is lasting and moreish.

title: Hirsch 2016 Ried Lamm Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine's enticingly flinty notes of reduction promise a long life ahead. The concentrated palate presents a characteristic and impressive Grüner Veltliner: ripe pear fruit with salty, lemon-tinged yeast and celery salt and miso nuances. This has layers of sophistication and fun.

title: Istine 2015 Vigna Istine  (Chianti Classico)
description: Iris, violet, perfumed berry, pine forest and aromatic herb aromas come into play on this fragrant red. The fresh, savory palate offers juicy Morello cherry, ripe blackberry, clove and star anise set against precise tannins and fresh acidity. It's well balanced and youthfully taut but will be even better in another few years. Drink 2019–2025.

title: K Vintners 2014 The Creator Powerline Estate Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (80%) takes the lead on this wine, which includes 20% Syrah. The aromas announce themselves, with appealing notes of green olive, herb, moist earth, stem, smoked meat and mineral. The mix of fruit and savory flavors delights the senses, showing intensity but also deftness.

title: Ken Brown 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pioneering winemaker Ken Brown is still making excellent wine 40 years on, including this bottling that's full of deep red cherry, scarlet red rose petals and dark hibiscus on a nose that's veiled by loamy soil and slate. The palate is tightly wound, with crushed herbs, sandy soils, cranberry and fresh purple-flower flavors that sail across the palate into a vanilla-kissed finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Holder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a bright, acid-driven wine, citrus-laden alongside crisp, tart red fruit and a light-bodied approach to ripeness. The nose is exotic in rose petal and lavender, with streaks of cardamom and cola spice that persist for a long time on the finish.

title: Loimer 2015 Anning Gumpoldskirchen Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)
description: A gamy streak plays on the nose as well as a touch of tart, red fruit. The palate also has an earthy undercurrent and a peppery, gamy edge. The fruit shimmers shyly amidst the finely taut tannins, with the promise of luscuous red cherry to come. This will benefit from further integration and will make an intriguing, savory wine.
